messages.subject: Coffee, was Re: About tv limits
messages.msgSnippet: ... LOL, that s cute. One of Mackenzie s early words was Starbucks! which he would shout whenever he saw the familiar green lady sign. He likes to go in and
messages.messageBody:
> From: dawn <dawn@...>
> i love to watch people
> when we go to coffee shops andhe goes up and orders his special coffee,
> then sits down with is nose in a book to drink it...looks like an exact
> miniature of his father.


LOL, that's cute. One of Mackenzie's early words was "Starbucks!" which he
would shout whenever he saw the familiar green lady sign. He likes to go in
and order a "mocha" which to him means chocolate milk.

As for coffee stunting your growth, one of my good friends is of Dutch
heritage, both his parents came over from Holland after WWII and are quite
small people. He and all of his siblings drank coffee and they are all about
6'4".

Personally, I can't drink it anymore because I can feel the effects of the
drug so keenly. I can't drink more than a half a glass of wine either,
more's the pity :-)

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "I told you I was going to grow up to be a
weirdo"
and Asa (10/5/99) Who says "Fishy swim!" at the aquarium, her favorite place
in the world
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers Flying Clevenger Family
